author: PerryThePlatypus
title: Whatâ€™s This?
review:
This figure is in a word, fantastic.

The general detailing of this figure is just outstanding with the stripe printing all over the arms and legs of the character, accurately representing the iconic character from the movie.

His accessories are awesome with his Halloween design of a present with snowflakes (They give you 2 designs of the snowflake piece as well as an extra of each design , which is absolutely welcome). The coattail is also a nice inclusion , along with the new mold for the collar piece, which has some very good attention to detail (like the bat ears, nose and eye molding on the collar). The face print is a big pleasant grin which looks great and I think it fits Jack very well.

Overall, if you're a fan of The Nightmare Before Christmas or Disney, you'll definitely love this figure. If you're not a Disney fan in general, there's still a lot of cool details to find in this fantastic figure. This figure genuinely feels like a Comic-Con exclusive minifigure made available easily to the public, yes, I love this figure THAT much. He is definitely the best figure of Disney minifigures series 2.  I completely recommend this for the price (buy multiples and keep them sealed, he'll go up in price, I'm sure of that). Pick this one up, I think you'll find a lot of enjoyment out of it.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: A dream come true
review:
Opening;

This figure is one I have wanted since i got my first minifigure as this film means so much to me and when it was revealed I was over the moon .

The Minifigure-

The figure has the iconic face of Jack printed on a white head , his bow tie is the only new mould and represents the in universe one greatly . The torso and coat tails flow very well into each other and the legs have since printing like the arms .

The accessories -

His accessory is a 2×2 present piece with a 2×2 white tile print for the lid the contense  of the present is two different 1×1 printed snow flakes on Trans clear round tiles . His stand is a standard CMF stand .

In conclusion-

this figure means a ton to me as this is a film I watch over and over again every Christmas always have done and I will recommend it to any Lego fan .

author: Odeinoichus
title: What's This? The Gift of Snow.
review:
Set #71024 Jack Skellington: Jack suffers from short leg syndrome. Not as wiry or thin as he could be, the Minifigure version of Jack still looks nice when standing next to Sally. Much like Sally there is a lot of attention to detail, with a very expansive print covering a good size surface area. The numerous black and white lines to capture the look of his gothic attire are very well-placed, though it is definitely telling the LEGO has yet to figure out a method of having prints on the inside of the arms and the sides of the torso. This would only serve to enhance such detail heavy characters, such as Jack.

He has a packaged gift with a nice detailed print on the box, this is the same present elements used from Series 18, in a suitably black and white primary scheme with bows to match. (Although the bow really should have been a spider design rather than traditional bow.) Inside are some printed 1x1 round tiles for snowflakes. I guess he's gifting someone snow for this Halloween... Christmas... Halloween? Oh whatever. He also includes a very nifty new neck piece shaped like his signature tie. This is bat like in design.

Overall Jack is very impressive. Love the attention to detail. Highly Recommended.
